feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 10:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues due to warmer temperatures. * WHERE...The northern Copper River Basin along the Gulkana River and along Lake Louise Road.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 06 at 8:56AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA TUESDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Tuesday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 9:42AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then a Breezy Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. Highs well into the 90s in Western Nevada and into the 80s for Sierra communities are expected, with potential for some records on Friday. There is a 20-25% chance of cities such as Reno and Fallon hitting 100 degrees on Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 9:42AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then a Breezy Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. Highs well into the 90s in Western Nevada and into the 80s for Sierra communities are expected, with potential for some records on Friday. There is a 20-25% chance of cities such as Reno and Fallon hitting 100 degrees on Friday.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 06 at 11:13AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAIN AND SNOW MELT WILL RESULT IN RISES ON RIVERS AND SMALL STREAMS IN THE CASCADES LATE THIS WEEK INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... An atmospheric river arrives on Thursday into the weekend bringing periods of moderate rainfall and warm, windy conditions. Rain amount of 1 to 3 inches is possible along the Cascade crest. In addition melting of mid and high elevation snow will add to runoff

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 2:00PM MDT until June 06 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM MDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WESTON COUNTY... At 159 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Clareton, or 17 miles west of Newcastle, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
